data.text: my experience at Be Premium Bodrum was nothing short of extraordinary. The combination of luxurious accommodations, exceptional service, and breathtaking surroundings made for a truly memorable stay. I can't wait to return to this idyllic retreat and create more unforgettable memories in Bodrum.
data.title: Amazing Vacation in Bodrum

data.text: Went early October it was shutting up around us. Jet 2 advertised restaurants didn’t shut until Nov so lied and lied when we contacted them. I won’t bore you don’t go in October unless you want to eat at the same place for lunch and dinner everyday. Poor management and rude reception who are too important to raise their head 🙄. Please spend your money somewhere else. I’ve never had to give a hotel in turkey 1 star but don’t see why they get away with this.
data.title: Simply don’t stay at Be Premium Bodrum

Thank you for sparing your time and sharing your valuable comments.

We are truly sorry for not meeting your expectations to the fullest..
Your valuable comments have been taken into consideration by the management.

If we can find the chance to host you again, we would be very happy to provide you with the full and freshly renewed Be Premium Hotel Bodrum experience.

Kind Regards ,

Be Premium Hotel Bodrum Management
owner_response.author: Duja Hotels

data.text:
As the title suggests, my designer aftershave was stolen, by what must have been a member of staff. This was reported in the lobby, and they didn't do anything about it. If i didn't have anything stolen from my room, or they would have gone the right way about sorting this out for me, it would have been a four out of five. 

Girls at the bar were great, with a special mention for Fatima, and the girls at the bar near the lobby, and the lifeguard Sami. The place is in a great location and is picturesque when looking from the top down, with great views. Most of the staff are really good and nothing was ever too hard to deal with. 

I think the welcome staff for a bit below par and lets the rest of the hotel down a little bit, as they weren't really that welcome on our arrival.
As it was the end of the holiday season after a couple of days our buffets became limited to about half the amount of food which was fine, because that would cut wastage and there wasn't a massive amount of holiday makers at the time we went.

The hotel looked bit tired and some parts but it was mostly really nice. The Romans were nice by borderline tacky with everything gold and a lot of the gold paint being marked off due to age and not being refurbished.

As I said previously, the theft from my room, was really unfortunate that someone in a five-star hotel would do such a thing, and on top of that nothing was done about it, so regardless of a lot of the workers hard work to make people have a special holiday when they're spending time there, this has been ruined by greedy people who had access to people's personal belongings thinking they should be able to take something like for themselves, and also for the staff not to do anything about it was in my view, disgusting. Anyone wanting to stay here I would advise you to put stuff in a safe of any value just to be sure, even though this may have been a one-off I was strongly advise it
data.title: Was great, apart from theft from our room 😢

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest Pete R,

Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable comments.

We are truly sorry that we could not fully meet your expectations.
Your valuable comments have been taken into consideration by the management.

Unfortunately, we cannot accept your claim regarding the loss of your aftershave. Necessary research has been done and it has not been found.

If we get the chance to host you again, we would be very happy to offer you the brand new Be Premium Hotel Bodrum experience.

Be Premium Hotel Bodrum Management
owner_response.author: Duja Hotels

data.text:
We chose Bodrum as we wanted to visit a different resort (we’ve holidayed in Kemer, Antalya and Belek several times). Our room was lovely and the hotel’s location is also lovely. 
We also read the reviews which the hotel had received.
We were very disappointed however that only two of the six a la carte restaurants were open in the evening (Lotus and Thetis) and five days into our holiday the poolside restaurant closed and didn’t reopen (an apparent “technical issue”). There’s was also only one bar available for a pre dinner drink….. 
It’s was a fight (an argument on the WhatsApp group chat) to book an a La carte restaurant as there was less availability of tables. We understood from staff that the hotel was now in “closed season”……..??? and the hotel was closing…..
Whilst we were disappointed the choice of food venue was much more limited, we’re angry that neither the hotel or our tour operator #Jet2 didn’t advise this when we booked. Had we known, we would have simply booked a different hotel…….
Some mornings we woke wondering which part of the hotel food and beverage service would close……on some days the hotel also ran out of Efes, gin, nuts & crisps, Diet Coke and Coke Zero……….(how can you run out of the national beer and coke 😳)
This isn’t the 5star resort advertised…..
data.title: Disappointed……..definitely not 5star

data.text:
When is a 5 Star premium resort not a 5 Start premium resort? When its half closed down and in the process of closing completely!!

We chose this hotel because of the great reviews it received, the range of facilities and excellent selection of A La Carte restaurants. What an utter disappointment that all was.

Upon arriving at the hotel we were informed 3 of the 6 restaurants were closed and the 3 actually still operating were only doing so on a rota basis thus severely limiting the restaurant selection and availability.

Subsequently we found out that the hotel was in the process of closing for the winter season and many other facilities such as bars, snack bars, evening entertainment and parts of the hotel were already closed and staff laid off.

Had we been made aware that this hotel was in the process of shutting down and only operating at 50% we would never booked to go.
The fact this is not made clear is a best a dubious practice.

The abcence of staff impacted upon the general levels of service - an example being served cocktails in paper Starbucks cups at the pool bar as there were no staff to collect the used glasses from around the pool area.

This hotel advertises itself as a 5 Star premium resort and as such that level of service should be available to EVERY guest ALL the time.
  
At the time of our stay this hotel is not 5 star and would barely qualify as 3 Star.
data.title: Miss Sold.
